answerText: "The Solitary Reaper"[10] "The Solitary Reaper" was penned by this romantic poet who collaborated with Coleridge on the collection Lyrical Ballads and wrote the long, autobiographical poem "The Prelude."
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 7 | 12 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title character of this poem sings "More welcome notes to weary bands" than the tune of the Nightingale, causing the speaker to wonder whether she sings of "sorrow, loss, or pain / That has been, and may be again."  For 10 points each: [10] Name this poem that concludes by telling how the music in the speaker's heart was bore "Long after it was heard no more."
